floodArea.riverOrSea: River Brathay, River Rothay, River Winster

items.description: Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water
items.message:
River levels have risen on the Upper River Derwent, Stonethwaite Beck and Derwent Water due to prolonged rainfall on Saturday 15/07/23 and overnight.
Areas most at risk include The Upper Derwent from Seathwaite to Derwent Water.
Flooding is possible in this area today 16/07/2023, to low lying land, roads and footpaths. Some further light rainfall is forecast this morning but thereafter the forecast is largely dry until Tuesday 18/07/23. The lake level is expected to remain high, and the risk of flooding to low-lying land remains.
We will continue to monitor levels closely.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.
This message will be updated by 09:30 AM on 17/07/2023, or as the situation changes.

River and lake levels on the River Greta, River Derwent, Derwent Water lake remain high following prolonged rainfall. Areas most at risk include low lying areas bordering the shores of Derwent Water and the frontage of the Keswick Camping and Caravan Club Site  . Flooding is expected to continue to affect low lying areas here overnight on 16/07/2023. The forecast overnight shows that occasional showers are possible but the level of Derwent Water is still expected to begin to fall slowly during Monday 17/07/2023. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 17/07/2023, or as the situation changes.
